ModuleDescription:
This is the first and introductory of a three-module series on
research methods that is required for all first-year PhD
students in Public Policy. The purposes of the module are to
introduce to students key concepts in research methods,
and to help them to develop skills in the design of empirical
research used in the analysis of policy problems. The aim is
that students are able to apply various research designs in
conducting rigorous policy research in their chosen fields, as
well as develop the ability to critically evaluate policy
research outputs.
Department: Lee Kuan Yew School Of Public Policy
